Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text:
Royal Tunbridge Wells is an affluent and historic Spa town situated approximately 35 miles south east of Central London. The Borough has a resident population of around 100,000 people. There is a mail train line station situated on Mount Pleasant Road with an average journey time approximately one hour to the capital. 
 The property is situated on the western side of Mount Pleasant Road and just meters from the entrance to the station.  Nearby occupiers include Starbucks, Cote Brasserie, NatWest Bank, and Barnardos

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
The demise offers a ground and first floor retail unit, with a large glass frontage. The unit offers 3 toilets, a kitchenette, HVAC and suspended ceilings. The unit is in a presentable condition and is rectangular in shape.

Tenure
The property is held on a leasehold basis with a lease expiry on 3rd April 2022.

Rent
The rent passing is £59,000 per annum exclusive

EPC
Energy Efficiency rating E- 125 Energy Performance Certificate available upon request.

Rates
We are verbally informed by the Local Rating Authority that the current Rateable Value of the shop is £44,000.00 and the rates payable are £21,604.00 pa. The UBR for 2019/2020 is 49.10p. Interested parties are advised to make their own enquiries with the Local Authority for verification purposes

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text:
The property is located in the town centre of Ashford, Kent.
Prominently situated on the corner of Bank Street and
Tufton Street, the unit benefits from return frontage and
fronts one of the primary entrances to County Square
Shopping Centre; the town’s primary retail destination.
Partly pedestrianised, Bank Street links with High Street
some 200m from the unit.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
The property is arranged over Ground and First Floor
levels. The ground floor is fitted as a bank with ancillary
accommodation to the rear. The first floor provides self
contained offices and is accessed via an independent
staircase leading directly off Bank Street. The space extends
to the rear over a demised garage/car port which offers
car parking for 2 cars.

Tenure
Leasehold

Rent
£67,500 per annum.

Terms
The premises are available by way of a sub-lease or
assignment of the existing effective FRI lease expiring
20/12/2021.
A copy of the lease is available on request.

Rates
We are informed by the Local Rating Authority that the
current Rateable Value of the property is £25,205.
Interested parties should make their own enquiries in this
regard.

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text:
Sittingbourne is a town in the borough of Swale in Kent. Sittingbourne train station provides high speed services to London terminals and offers quick access to the M2 and M25 motorways, via the A2. 

Occupiers within the immediate vicinity are Lidl Supermarket, Wilkos & Lloyds Bank.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
The premises are comprised over ground floor. The unit offers an open plan sales area with amenities to the rear which include a kitchenette, staff room and an office.

Tenure
By way of assignment of two co-terminous leases expiring 18/07/2025.

A sublease may be considered.

Rent
£25,000 per annum.

Rates
The rateable value is £25,000.

Interested parties are advised to make their own enquiries with the Local Authority for verification purposes.

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text: Whitstable, a seaside town located on the north coast of Kent, approximately 8km (5 miles) north of Canterbury. The property is situated in what is considered the prime pitch on the High Street with a public pay and display car park situated at the rear.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
The property, a corner unit shop, has excellent visibility from the main road. Internally, the unit is made up of the main betting hall, with a small kitchen and toilets.

Tenure
The premises are available by way of an assignment or sublease of the existing lease expiring 7th February 2023.

Rent
£40,000 per annum exclusive.

Rates
We understand that the current Rateable Value is £29,250 and the Rates Payable are £14,337 per annum. The UBR for 2019/20 is 49.1p.
Interested parties are advised to make their own enquiries with the Local Authority for verification purposes.

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text:
Rainham, a Medway town in Kent, is situated less than 4 miles from Gillingham and approximately 15 miles from Maidstone. The town benefits from good transport links, with both the M2 and the M20 within a short drive.
The property is situated in close proximity to the entrance to Rainham Shopping Centre. Nearby retailers also include Costa Coffee, Greggs and a mix of local operators.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
The property is arranged over ground and first floor, with the whole demise being previously utilised by the bank. The ground floor was made up of the banking hall and customer facing rooms, with ancillary space on the first floor.

Tenure
The property is held on an existing FRI lease due to expire 09/03/2024.
Offers considered at the current passing rent of £19,500 per annum exclusive.

Rates
The property is held on an existing FRI lease due to expire 09/03/2024.
Offers considered at the current passing rent of £19,500 per annum exclusive.

Bluewater sets the standard for the industry in CACI’s Shopper Dimensions benchmarks of retail spend, catering spend, dwell and conversion rate.

Only out-of-town destination in CACI and Experian’s top ten rankings, and ranked number one in the UK by CACI, Experian and Javelin. 

Catchment extends from south east London to Kent, Surrey and most of Sussex, its on of the largest retail catchments in the UK, AND it adjoins Ebbsfleet Garden City, one of largest regeneration projects in UK, it will deliver 15,000 houses in the immediate vicinity to Bluewater and 180,000 in region.  1700 already on site.  5,000 jobs being created as local workforce will live, work and enjoy one of the best connected new communities in our generation.

- 28 million footfall per annum

- 6.6 million people in the catchment with £13 billion of available spend

- Affluent consumers dominate the catchment (63% are from the top three Acorn profiles) and visitor profile (70%)

- It is safe and family friendly: with on site police force, 13,000 free recently refurbished parking spaces

- Easy access to London from Ebbsfleet International, which is only 17 minute train journey to London St Pancras, on HS1.



KEY BRANDS

Flagship Next, H&M (40,000 sq ft), Primark (65,000 sq ft) and Zara are also on site upsizing to 40,000 sq ft. 

A great number of international brands have chosen Bluewater for their first store outside London, or their first in the South East.  Includes Breitling, Jo Malone, Nespresso, Tesla, Coach, Kate Spade, ARKET, Penhaligons, Polo Ralph Lauren. 

In addition, we have expanded on the leisure offer, adding Gravity, Dinotropolis (children’s soft play) alongside 4 new restaurants, which is in addition to a 17 screen Showcase cinema and 60+ café’s / restaurants

Rent
On application.

Rates
On application.

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text:
Bluewater is one of Europe’s largest and best performing shopping centres, anchored by John Lewis, House of Fraser and Marks & Spencer. The scheme benefits from 27 million visitors per year with a catchment of 6.6 million from one of the most affluent demographics in the UK.  
The subject premises are situated in a prominent position on Upper Rose Gallery, which offers the very best of high street and fashion brands including Topshop/Topman, River Island, Fat Face and Fred Perry, as well as Le Creuset adjacent.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
The premises are arranged over ground floor only with the following approximate dimensions and internal floor areas. 
In addition, a remote store unit is available. Further information available upon request.

Lease Terms
The premises are held on a full repairing and insuring lease for a term expiring 24th March 2023 with a final rent review on 25th March 2021.

Rent
£230,000 per annum exclusive

Incentive
Incentives available subject to covenant

Rates
We are verbally informed by the Local Rating Authority that the current Rateable Value of the shop is £270,219 and the rates payable are £133,217 pa. The UBR for 2018/2019 is 49.3p. Interested parties are advised to make their own enquiries with the Local Authority for verification purposes
